title: AI Clone Personality Questionnaire - Age-Appropriate & Concise
description: Enhanced personality assessment with age-appropriate communication styles, concise responses, and realistic response patterns

changes: Enforced concise responses - no paragraphs, max 50 characters for text inputs
Converted free-form text inputs to multiple choice with brief 'Other' options
Added character limits for name (30), location (40), occupation (35)
Updated response length options to be more realistic (shorter, like current gen)
Enhanced generation-specific language and behavior patterns
Added realistic conversation starters and communication preferences
Improved personality mapping for more human-like clones
Added Stage 0: Basic Information & Core Personality for all clones
Includes essential questions: basic info, communication style, Big Five traits
Maintains existing 4 stages for relationship depth

stage_0.name: Basic Information & Core Personality
stage_0.description: Essential foundational information required for all clones - basic details, communication preferences, and core personality traits
stage_0.timing: Immediately upon clone creation - required for all

stage_1.name: Initial Engagement & Public Persona
stage_1.description: Orientation Stage of Social Penetration Theory - Superficial, publicly observable preferences
stage_1.timing: After basic info is complete, within first 1-3 days

stage_2.name: Exploring Preferences & Light Social Attitudes
stage_2.description: Exploratory Affective Exchange Stage - General opinions and broader lifestyle choices

stage_3.name: Deeper Values & Emotional Context
stage_3.description: Affective Exchange Stage - Personal values and emotional drivers
stage_3.tone: Reflective and empathetic, seeking genuine insights

stage_4.name: Personal Experiences & Commitment Signals
stage_4.description: Stable Exchange Stage - Personal experiences and long-term relationship goals
stage_4.tone: Private, empathetic, and highly respectful of boundaries

stage_0_basic_info.name: Stage 0: Basic Information & Core Personality
stage_0_basic_info.description: Essential foundational information required for all clones

questions.text: What is your name?
What is your age?
Where are you located?
What is your occupation or what do you do for work?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Software Engineer, Student, Artist, etc.

questions.text: What generation do you identify with?
options: Gen Z (1997-2012) - Digital native, social media savvy, short attention span
Millennial (1981-1996) - Grew up with internet, optimistic, work-life balance
Gen X (1965-1980) - Independent, pragmatic, tech-adaptive, skeptical
Boomer (1946-1964) - Traditional values, face-to-face communication, formal
Silent Generation (1928-1945) - Formal, respectful, traditional, patient

questions.text: What life stage are you currently in?
options: Teenager (13-19) - School, friends, discovering identity, social media
Young Adult (20-29) - College/career, independence, relationships, figuring life out
Adult (30-49) - Career, family, responsibilities, established but busy
Middle Age (50-64) - Established, wisdom, new priorities, reflection
Senior (65+) - Retirement, legacy, reflection, slower pace

stage_0_communication_style.name: Stage 0: Communication Style Preferences
stage_0_communication_style.description: How you prefer to communicate and express yourself

questions.text: How formal do you prefer to be in communication?
options: Very formal (professional, proper language, complete sentences)
Moderately formal (balanced, respectful, mostly proper)
Casual (hi, cool, nice, relaxed but clear)
Very casual (slang, abbreviations, like texting friends)

questions.text: What's your preferred humor style?
options: Playful/silly (funny memes, dad jokes, lighthearted)
Witty/sarcastic (clever, ironic, sometimes dry)
Dry/deadpan (subtle, understated humor)
Warm/gentle (kind, uplifting, positive)
I don't use much humor (serious, focused conversations)

questions.text: How expressive are you in conversations?
options: Very expressive (lots of emotion, gestures, enthusiasm)
Moderately expressive (shows feelings, but balanced)
Balanced (shows some emotion, but controlled)
Reserved (calm, measured, thoughtful responses)
Very reserved (minimal expression, mostly factual)

questions.text: How long do you prefer your responses to be?
options: Very short (like texting - 1-2 sentences max)
Short and concise (2-3 sentences, to the point)
Medium length (3-4 sentences, balanced detail)
Detailed and thorough (4+ sentences, comprehensive)
Varies based on the topic and my mood

questions.text: What's your preferred conversation pace?
options: Fast-paced and energetic (quick responses, lots of energy)
Moderate pace (normal speed, comfortable rhythm)
Thoughtful and measured (pause to consider, then respond)
Slow and deliberate (take time to think, careful responses)

questions.text: How do you typically communicate in modern conversations?
options: Use emojis and modern slang (lol, omg, tbh, fr, no cap)
Mix of modern and traditional language
Mostly traditional language with some modern touches
Very traditional and formal language
Varies based on who I'm talking to and the context

questions.text: What's your texting/messaging style?
options: Very casual with lots of abbreviations (u, r, ur, lol, omg, ttyl)
Casual but proper spelling (hey, cool, nice, but spelled correctly)
Balanced - some abbreviations but mostly proper
Mostly proper spelling and grammar
Always proper spelling and grammar (professional style)

questions.text: How do you feel about using emojis?
options: Love them! Use emojis all the time ðŸ˜Š
Use them sometimes, when they fit the mood
Use them occasionally, mostly for emphasis
Rarely use them, prefer words
Never use emojis, find them unnecessary

questions.text: How would you describe your level of extraversion?
options: Very extroverted - I'm super social and love meeting people
Somewhat extroverted - I'm generally outgoing and friendly
Balanced - I'm comfortable in both social and quiet situations
Somewhat introverted - I prefer smaller groups and meaningful conversations
Very introverted - I need alone time and prefer deep conversations over small talk

questions.text: How open are you to new experiences and ideas?
options: Very open - I love trying new things and exploring ideas
Quite adventurous - I'm usually up for new experiences
Moderately open - I'm willing to try some new things
Somewhat cautious - I prefer familiar routines and proven methods
Very traditional - I stick to what I know works well

questions.text: How organized and responsible are you?
options: Very organized and detail-oriented - I love planning and structure
Generally organized - I keep things in order most of the time
Moderately organized - I'm organized when I need to be
Somewhat disorganized - I'm more spontaneous and flexible
Very spontaneous - I prefer to go with the flow and adapt

questions.text: How do you typically interact with others?
options: Very cooperative and trusting - I believe in the best in people
Generally helpful and considerate - I try to be supportive
Balanced - I'm generally helpful but also realistic
Sometimes skeptical - I'm cautious about trusting too easily
Very direct - I'm honest and straightforward, even if it's challenging

questions.text: How do you handle stress and negative emotions?
options: Very calm and emotionally stable - I handle stress well
Generally relaxed - I'm usually pretty chill about things
Normal stress levels - I get stressed like most people
Sometimes anxious - I can worry about things more than others
Very sensitive - I feel emotions deeply and can get overwhelmed

questions.text: Which best describes your ideal weekend?

Relaxing at home with personal projects.
Socializing with friends and family.

stage_3_deeper_values.name: Stage 3: Deeper Values & Emotional Context
stage_3_deeper_values.description: Personal values, deeper desires for connection, and insights into emotional responses

questions.text: My greatest passion is focused on [category] because it allows me to [reason]:
When facing challenges or stressful situations, which approach do you most commonly take?
options: I tend to focus on problem-solving and finding practical solutions.
I seek emotional support from trusted friends or family.
I prefer to take a break and return with a fresh perspective.
I try to learn from the experience and adapt for the future.

questions.text: Which of these is a non-negotiable value you seek in a significant relationship or friendship?
options: Honesty and integrity.
Mutual respect and understanding.
Shared growth and personal development.
Emotional intelligence and empathy.
Independence and personal space.

questions.text: What type of emotional support do you find most meaningful when you are struggling?
options: Practical advice and solutions.
Active listening and validation of my feelings.
Comforting words and reassurance.
Distraction or a change of scenery.

questions.text: Beyond initial attraction, what makes you feel truly connected to another person?
options: Deep, meaningful conversations.
Shared experiences and creating new memories.
Feeling understood and accepted for who I am.
Mutual vulnerability and trust.

stage_4_personal_experiences.name: Stage 4: Personal Experiences & Commitment Signals
stage_4_personal_experiences.description: Personal experiences, vulnerabilities, and insights into long-term relationship goals or commitment styles

questions.text: Which category best describes a significant life experience that has profoundly shaped who you are today?
options: Overcoming a major personal challenge (e.g., illness, significant loss).
A transformative travel or cultural immersion experience.
Achieving a major personal or professional goal.
A significant relationship experience (e.g., friendship, family, romantic).
A period of intense self-discovery or personal growth.

questions.text: Which of these personal fears or vulnerabilities do you relate to most?
options: Fear of failure or not living up to expectations.
Fear of rejection or not being "enough".
Difficulty trusting others fully.
Struggling with self-doubt or insecurity.
Fear of loneliness or being alone.

questions.text: How do you primarily envision building long-term commitment and trust in a relationship?
options: Through consistent honesty and transparency.
By sharing experiences and building a shared future.
Through mutual emotional support and understanding.
By giving each other space for individual growth while remaining connected.
Through open communication and conflict resolution.

questions.text: For you, what is the most important aspect of a genuine, lasting connection?
options: Unwavering loyalty and reliability.
Deep emotional intimacy and vulnerability.
Shared life goals and aspirations.
Feeling truly accepted and understood.
Continuous growth and adaptation together.

questions.text: Which single piece of advice would you offer for navigating and sustaining meaningful relationships?
options: Prioritise open and honest communication, even when difficult.
Remember to consistently show appreciation and affection.
Be willing to adapt and compromise as changes occur.
Invest time in shared experiences and building new memories.
Respect each other's individuality and give space for personal growth.
